metadata.Title: CVE-2016-4651 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability in the WebKit JavaScript bindings in Apple iOS before 9.3.3 and Safari before 9.1.2 allows remote attackers to inject arbitrary web script or HTML via a crafted HTTP/0.9 response, related to a "cross-protocol cross-site scripting (XPXSS)" vulnerability.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-4651` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-4.0 - 2.12.5-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
gir1.2-webkit2-4.0 - 2.12.5-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-18 - 2.12.5-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-bin - 2.12.5-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libwebkit2gtk-4.0-37 - 2.12.5-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libwebkit2gtk-4.0-37-gtk2 - 2.12.5-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: jdstrand> webkit receives limited support. For details, see https://wiki.ubuntu.com/SecurityTeam/FAQ#webkit webkit in Ubuntu uses the JavaScriptCore (JSC) engine, not V8

criterions.comment: qtwebkit-opensource-src: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'no update available').
qtwebkit-source: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
webkit2gtk package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.12.5-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
webkitgtk: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
